data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you will take 9 steps left and 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps left and 10 steps forward and 10 steps backward. Thus, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You take 4 steps and turn around. You turn right at the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To turn around you take 12 Steps. To take 6 steps you take 6 Steps. And take 4 steps you take 4 Steps. So, the answer is No.

Go straight ahead. Taking 7 steps, you end up taking 7 steps. Taking 1 step returns you to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

You would have to take 10 steps to get back to the starting point in this scenario. So, the answer is Yes.

There are 6 steps for turning around, 8 steps for returning, and 2 steps for taking 2 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

People always face forward when they are walking. If you only face the wrong direction, you will become stuck in your current direction and fail to walk forward, you will inevitably end up in a new direction. People always take 4 steps unless they are going to miss one. Steps are based on the number of steps taken, so you must continue to be facing forward in your previous direction. So, the answer is yes.

You can take more than the number of steps listed on the instructions. You can take 2 steps for each of the steps listed on line. So, the answer is Yes.

You always face forward always. You take 1 step backwards only once. So, the answer is no.

If you continue to face forward, you take one step backward and take 2 steps left. There are 2 ways of returning to your starting point. Therefore, the answer is No.

Facing forward is the first step to return to starting point. Take 4 steps left to go 2 steps forward. Take 3 steps forward to go 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right to return to starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

When facing forward, it will be more difficult to return to the starting point to avoid hurting yourself. Even if you always face forward, you still face towards your starting point where you started. Since you took 3 steps right and your starting point was facing forward, you still face forward. Walking left, for instance, is very different from facing forward due to you facing inwards and hence taking the wrong path backward. Therefore, the answer is No.
